content.prompt: Based on the diagram, which of the following describes the most likely effect that glaciers melting in Greenland and the Arctic would have on the surface currents of the North Atlantic?

choices.label: The East Greenland current will reverse directions as sea levels rise.
The Labrador current will be deflected by icebergs that break off from the glaciers.
The warm surface currents will become cooler, and the cool oceanic currents will become warmer.
The Norwegian current will become cooler and less salty.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain how environmental concepts and processes represented visually relate to broader environmental issues.
